intro: Deiregyne densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered deiregyne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its foliage is thick and waxy, adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat.
